channel.title: Journey to Ancient Civilizations
channel.description: Travel to the modern day locations of the great ancient civilizations with Peabody Charter School teacher Marty Robertson as he discovers clues to the past using history, geology, and culture as his guides.
channel.itunes:author: Rich Dixon, Peabody Charter School
channel.itunes:subtitle: Travel to the modern day locations of the great ancient civilizations with Peabody Charter School teacher Marty Robertson as he discovers clues to the past using history, geology, and culture as his guides.
channel.itunes:keywords: Education, social studies, Ancient, Civilizations, Travel, History, Geology, Culture, Peabody Charter School, Marty Robertson, Rich Dixon, sabbatical, sixth grade, 6th grade, Santa Barbara

item.title: Greek Culture, Geology, and History
item.description: The Geology of Santorini and Athens plus a brief history of ancient Greece are set into context via modern day Athens.
item.itunes:author: Rich Dixon - Peabody Charter School
item.itunes:subtitle: Ancient Greece, geology, and modern culture.
item.itunes:summary: Marty Roberston describes living in and around the ancient world while experiencing modern Greek culture. His visits in an around Athens and the island of Santorini yield interesting geological information that helped shape today's Greece.

item.title: Giza, Luxor, and Saqqara - Episode 4
item.description: This interview with Marty Robertson recounts notable features of the mix of modern and ancient influences on culture, historical interpretation, and geology in Giza, Luxor, and Saqqara Egypt.
item.itunes:author: Rich Dixon - Peabody Charter School
item.itunes:subtitle: The culture, historical interpretation, and geology in Giza, Luxor, and Saqqara Egypt.

item.title: Cairo - Episode 3
item.description: Visit Islamic and Coptic Cairo Egypt as history and culture guide the tour.
item.itunes:author: Rich Dixon - Peabody Charter School
item.itunes:subtitle: Coptic and Islamic Cairo
item.itunes:summary: Marty Robertson leads us through a tour of the Mosque of Sayyidna al-Hussein, the Kahn al-Kahlili bazaar, and the largest minaret at the Mosque of al-Azhar and the sights of Coptic Cairo.

item.title: Student Thoughts and Questions - Episode 2
item.description: 6th grade students provide a series of questions about the nature of the trip to the modern day location of ancient civilizations.
item.itunes:author: Rich Dixon, Peabody Charter School
item.itunes:subtitle: Questions from students and their dreams for a similar trip.
item.itunes:summary: Marty Robertson's students have an opportunity to ask about the trip and provide some of their own thoughts on modern day locations they would like to visit in order to study ancient civilizations.

item.title: Journey Background - Episode 1
item.description: This episode provides the inspiration and rationale for the trip and gives listeners an introduction to Marty Robertson, who's journey is the focus of the Podcast.
item.itunes:author: Rich Dixon, Peabody Charter School
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Marty Robertson
item.itunes:summary: An in-depth interview with 6th grade teacher Marty Robertson as he outlines his objectives for his trip as will as his inspiration for it.

item.title: Introduction - Episode 0
item.description: Overview of this series of Podcasts.
item.itunes:author: Rich Dixon, Peabody Charter School
item.itunes:subtitle: Journey to Ancient Civilizations Introduction
item.itunes:summary: This episode gives a short overview of the project.
